questionText: Yanis noticed that the beach where he lives has become overrun with trash, and he has developed a machine that will 'walk' the beach to pick up the trash. We could classify Yanis as a ________.

Patel launched a lawn care business, sold it after two years, started a transportation business to serve those in his community who do not drive, sold it to one of his employees, and started a micro-loan business, which he plans to sell within five years. We could classify Patel as a(n) ________ entrepreneur.

Ramon lost his job during the Great Recession. After taking inventory of his assets and skill set, he launched a small engine repair service from his garage. We could classify Ramon as a(n) ________ entrepreneur.
An entrepreneurial venture and a small business ________.
One key difference between an entrepreneurial venture and a small business is that the entrepreneurial venture focuses on ________.
When it was first starting out, the Viking Range company qualified as an entrepreneurial organization because its products were ________.
Besides being innovative in some way, a second defining characteristic of an entrepreneurial venture is that it is ________.
An 'accidental entrepreneur' is someone who became an entrepreneur because he or she ________.
multipleChoice: always had a dream to start a company

questionText: In the wake of high unemployment, statistics show that entrepreneurship is ________.
After five years, ________ of entrepreneurial ventures are still in business.
In most cases, the first step in the initial (pre-planning) phase of the entrepreneurial process is this.
Which one of the following is typically involved in exploring the entrepreneurial context of a new venture?
Uncovering business ideas, looking at competitors, and exploring financing options are part of this phase of the entrepreneurial process.
________ is an important part of researching a firm's feasibility.
Early in the planning phase of an entrepreneurial venture, ________ is accomplished.
multipleChoice: selecting a legal business organization form

questionText: During the organizing phase of an entrepreneurial venture, an entrepreneur ________.
multipleChoice: selects a legal business organization form

questionText: After the startup has been planned and organized, the next step is ________.
During the launching of a venture, which one of the following is accomplished?
Once an entrepreneurial venture is actually up and running, the entrepreneur switches to a ________ role.
According to Peter Drucker, which one of the following is a source of opportunities for entrepreneurs?

Samovar has an idea for a new business. He is currently engaged in identifying potential competitors to determine what they offer, how they market their products, and what their competitive advantages may be. Samovar is ________.
A(n) ________ is the simplest and briefest type of business plan.
The ________ of a business plan should include the mission statement and primary goals of the organization as well as a brief description of the product or service.
Information about the size of the target market will be found in the ________ in the business plan.
This is the most complete and comprehensive type of business plan.
A brief mission statement of an entrepreneurial venture would be included in this section of a full business plan.
This section of a full business plan would include possible income statements for the next three years.
Identification of the organization's key personnel would be included in this section of a full business plan.
This section of a full business plan would include a description of the demographics of the target market for the organization.
This section of a full business plan would include an assessment of the industry of the venture and how it fits into the overall economic climate.
Marva wants to be in control of her destiny. If she were to launch her own business, she would be most likely to prefer the ________ form of ownership.
Granval is concerned about the risks involved in launching a new business, especially the financial risks. If he chooses the sole proprietorship form of ownership, his liability is ________.
multipleChoice: limited to the amount of his taxes

questionText: Granval thinks a partnership will reduce his personal financial responsibility. This is true only if ________.
multipleChoice: Granval is not the general partner
the other partners agree to it
the articles of incorporation stipulate the percentages of liability of each partner
there are no more than 10 partners

questionText: Belor has been invited to become a limited partner in a new business. Belor feels that if he is putting up some of the money to launch the business, he should have some say in how it is managed. This can happen only if ________.
multipleChoice: Belor provides more than 50% of the capital
the partnership agreement names Belor as CEO

questionText: Tamaya is ready to launch her new business but needs more money. Although she has a high credit rating, she does not want to 'max out' all her credit cards. You advise her to select ________.
multipleChoice: an S corporation because she does not expect to ever have more than 75 partners
a sole proprietorship so she does not have to share the profits with anyone
a limited liability partnership so she can share the burden of financing the new business
a C corporation so she can sell stock immediately

questionText: One of the most important factors influencing the organizational success of a new venture is ________.
The form of legal ownership that an entrepreneur chooses for a venture primarily affects these concerns.
Entrepreneurs should take great care when choosing a form of legal ownership because once one form is chosen, it is ________ to change it to another form.
Which one of the following is NOT a way to organize an entrepreneurial venture?
Many small entrepreneurial firms don't have a deliberately planned organizational structure because ________.
multipleChoice: the IRS prevents them from having a structure

questionText: In general, an entrepreneurial venture that sees ________ as its competitive advantage would tend to be ________ in structure.
An entrepreneurial venture whose goal is to create humorous video games would be likely to be ________.
When hiring, entrepreneurs are more likely to make sure that these two elements are a good match than traditional HRM managers.
multipleChoice: formal job training and organizational requirements

questionText: At an entrepreneurial organization, job candidates are more likely to hear about ________ than they will at conventional organizations.
Which one of the following statements regarding an "entrepreneurial personality" is true?
multipleChoice: Finding a set of personality traits for an entrepreneurial personality is much easier than for leaders.
Finding a set of personality traits for an entrepreneurial personality is more difficult than for leaders.
There is no specific set of personality traits that all entrepreneurs share.
There has been research on this topic as to date.

questionText: Which one of the following terms does not fit the classic profile of the successful entrepreneur?
In general, entrepreneurs tend to ________ more than the average person.
A person with a proactive personality is someone who ________.
People who become entrepreneurs often have ________.
multipleChoice: no family members who are entrepreneurs

questionText: Perhaps the best predictor of whether or not a person will become an entrepreneur is how ________ she is.
The key to the proactive personality is that a proactive person feels that he or she can ________ any environment.
A proactive person would be most likely to say this about his or her life.
multipleChoice: If I don't like something, I fix it.
If I don't like something, I learn to live with it.
I like to leave well enough alone.

questionText: With respect to entrepreneurship, a proactive person is best described as someone who has skill in identifying ________.
In general, employee empowerment ________ motivation in employees.
The typical reason for why an entrepreneur considers implementing employee empowerment in an organization is to make sure that the organization ________.
Entrepreneurs who have trouble delegating authority should go through the process of empowering employees ________.
The best way for a hesitant entrepreneur to begin the process of employee empowerment is to ________.
multipleChoice: give employees complete decision-making power immediately
let the employees decide how much decision-making power they will have
order employees to start making decisions

questionText: A leader of an entrepreneurial organization is like a jazz band leader because he or she ________.
multipleChoice: wants a happy and harmonious workplace
has no influence over what the performers "play"
works to draw the "best" out of every performer

questionText: An entrepreneur's ability to be a visionary is important because visionary companies tend to ________.
multipleChoice: have employees who are satisfied with their jobs
be more successful than nonvisionary companies
be more organic than nonvisionary companies

questionText: A ________ type of work team has the most autonomy.
This type of work team has authority to implement the changes it recommends.
This type of work team is composed of specialists.
An entrepreneur should ________ a plan for dealing with an economic downturn ________ any downturn occurs.
Harvesting an entrepreneurial venture occurs when the venture ________.
To avoid problems in their personal lives, entrepreneurs need to become excellent time managers and ________.
multipleChoice: prioritize what needs to be done
wait to see what needs can be ignored
handle all needs long before they are needed

questionText: This is one of the best ways for entrepreneurs to deal with especially difficult work-related or personal problems.
multipleChoice: develop a network of trusted peers
